thread.title: India's Ambassador car brand bought by Peugeot
thread.title_full: India's Ambassador car brand bought by Peugeot

author: David Millward
title: India's Ambassador car brand bought by Peugeot
text:
India's Ambassador car brand bought by Peugeot India's iconic Ambassador brand sold to Peugeot Credit: AFP 
F or decades the Ambassador has been a common sight on India’s roads. 
Now the iconic brand has been sold to Peugeot for £9.6 million by Hindustan motors. 
Based on the Morris Oxford, it was the car of choice for ministers and civil servants as well as taxi drivers. If not the most stylish of vehicles, its suspension was perfect for the country’s pothole-strewn roads. 
While Peugeot has been keen to gain a foothold in the growing market, it remains unclear whether the company will revive production of the Ambassador, the BBC reported. 
The Ambassador was something of a status symbol in India. It was the one of the earliest diesel models to appear in the country and it also had air conditioning. Watch | End of the road for India's Ambassador taxis? 01:19 
T ough and easy to maintain the company flourished. In the 1980s the company was selling 20,000 models a year. 
But the “Amby”, which had changed little since it first rolled off the production line in 1957, fell out of favour with the country’s motorists. Sales dropped to around 2,000 by 2013-14.
